header: Federal Circuit revives computer memory patent case against Nvidia
body:
A federal appeals court on Tuesday revived a non-practicing entity’s patent infringement case against video chipmaker Nvidia Corp, finding that the asserted patent does not claim an abstract idea.

In a 2-1 decision, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit said that a lower court judge erred in invalidating a patent relating to computer memory that Visual Memory LLC accused Nvidia’s graphics cards of infringing.

To read the full story on Westlaw Practitioner Insights, click here: bit.ly/2vZmclL
